JUDGES: Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Mr GPE , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON , from ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant was renting a small apartment from S. , a former Stateowned company . On an unspecified date , he made an offer to buy the apartment under PERSON no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , but he did not receive an answer to the request . He therefore lodged an action with LOC seeking to have PERSON compelled to sell him the apartment . His action was allowed on DATE , a decision upheld on appeal by ORG .

CARDINAL . NORP However , in a final decision of DATE , ORG allowed an appeal on points of law lodged by PERSON and dismissed the initial action . The applicant 's lawyer was present at the delivery of the said decision .
CARDINAL . The reasoning of the final decision was completed on DATE . The case file , including the complete text of the final decision , was returned to ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . According to the case - file , the applicant obtained a certified copy of the final decision on DATE .

CARDINAL . LAW provides that copies of decisions are served on the parties only when this is necessary to start the time - limit for bringing an appeal running . As a consequence , final decisions are not served on the parties , on whom it is incumbent to take the necessary steps to obtain a copy . In practice , copies are obtained from the first - instance court , where the case file , together with the final decision , is archived .
